poem:
Title: "The Failure Line"

Nationalism crows at morning's break,
On broken promises, we futilely wake.
Potholes and fractures adorn our land,
A failed continuum, a weakling's hand.

In the acid of confusion, our trust decays,
The political castles, in spectral array
Unanswered challenges, large and small,
Within our hearts, a nation's fall.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "On challenges big and small, our leaders haven’t learned that nationalism is not the answer | Rafael Behr Brexit isn’t working, and there are potholes everywhere. Those are not equivalent challenges. Fresh asphalt heals cracked carriageways in an afternoon. Repairing a fractured continental alliance is the work of a generation. One problem did not cause the other. But they are on the vast continuum of political failure – from global to local – that coincides". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
